comments.body: if there's a line break after the (, there should be one before the )
I'm worried about why this is needed. It could be an underlying bug. We should file an issue to make sure we track down the original cause.
I have no idea.. I had to try many variations of black magic to get it to repro in the test environment (it repro'd fine manually). Not sure what sort of bug to file about that.

Just file a bug describing how to trigger something manually, and point to this code saying that for some reason the test framework needs this to make it trigger. So long as the issue is clear enough about how to reproduce the difference, eventually I'll get around to investigating it.

The tricky part here is that it won't happen anymore with this fix. Or, presumably, with your changes to Scrollable. The only way to see that this is broken is running this code against the framework before this fix lands.
Can one can put a print somewhere in the code (even today's code) that shows a difference between the test and manual testing?
